data.title: Citi Exec Joins JPMorgan Chase As Head Of Channels
data.text: Lisa Davis, former Citigroup executive, is joining with J.P. Morgan Chase as the company's new head of Channels, according to a news release emailed to PYMNTS.

data.title: Too Safe To Fail: My 3 Favorite Undervalued Banks
data.text: The Federal reserve just released another round of stress tests, with individual bank data. I have been repeating that banks are a lot different than they were 10 years ago. The fed's stress tests prove this.

data.title: US bank stocks surge after Fed clears way for up to $11 billion of buybacks
data.text: US bank stocks rallied on Monday after the Federal Reserve announced it would allow firms to restart multibillion-dollar stock repurchase programs in 2021. The central bank said Friday afternoon that banks can resume stock buybacks at limited capacities. The new rules stipulate the sum of a bank's dividend payments and buybacks in the first quarter can't exceed the average quarterly earnings from the four most recent quarters.

data.title: Banks receive Fed approval to buy back stock
data.text: Bank stocks rallied sharply Monday after the Federal Reserve gave financial institutions the greenlight to buy back shares.

data.title: Final Trades: JPMorgan, Vulcan Materials, Darden Restaurants & more

data.title: Why JPMorgan Stock Jumped Today
data.text: Investors have 30 billion more reasons to buy the banking titan's shares.

data.title: Pawar Law Group Reminds Investors of Important Dec. 23 Deadline in Securities Class Action Lawsuit Against JPMorgan Chase & Co.– JPM
data.text: NEW YORK, Dec. 21, 2020 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Pawar Law Group announces that a class action lawsuit has been filed on behalf of shareholders who purchased shares of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) from February 23, 2016 through September 23, 2020, inclusive (the “Class Period”). The lawsuit seeks to recover damages for JPMorgan Chase & Co. investors under the federal securities laws. If you wish to serve as lead plaintiff, you must move the Court no later than December 23, 2020.

data.title: Mike Mayo on Fed allowing banks to resume share buybacks
data.text: Bank analyst Mike Mayo, Wells Fargo, discusses what it means to banks and financials now that the Fed says financials institutions should be able to resume some buybacks in 2021.

data.title: Markets Are Falling Monday -- But These 5 Stocks Are Looking Up
data.text: Find out what about these companies is making investors happy.

data.title: Financials will be higher a year from now: KBW
data.text: NBC's "Squawk on the Street" team discusses why markets are down while financials are higher with Tom Michaud, CEO of KBW, a Stifel company.

data.title: Bank Stocks Rise On Buyback Optimism
data.text: Bank stocks traded higher on a brutal morning on Wall Street on Monday after the Federal Reserve said banks can resume their share buybacks in the first quarter of 2021. What Happened?

data.title: Bank Stocks in Rally Mode After Fed Directive
data.text: The Federal Reserve has given the go-ahead for banks to resume limited dividend and share repurchase programs.

data.title: Fed Unveils 2nd Stress Test Results, Eases Capital Distribution Limits
data.text: The results of the second round of stress test, following which the Fed eased restrictions on capital deployment by banks, highlight capital adequacy of the banking sector.

data.title: These Bank Stocks Rally Following Great News From The Fed
data.text: Bank stocks declined a lot during the spring sell-off and have underperformed the market this year. Worries about high credit losses seem overblown.

data.title: Banks stocks rally to buck broader market selloff after Fed to allow share buybacks again
data.text: Bank stocks are showing green in sea of red in premarket trading Monday, after the Federal Reserve said late Friday it will allow big banks to start buying back stock again, restrictions which were put in place in June amid concerns over the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Fed said the latest stress tests confirmed that the big banks were in good financial health despite the recession.

data.title: The December CCAR Is Hugely Bullish For The Banks
data.text: The Fed is allowing buybacks to resume. This is a bullish signal for the large U.S. banks.
